--- title: "YNHHS Epic Cosmos" description: |
The Cosmos data set combines billions of clinical data points, made up of data from across the Epic community, to form the largest database of Electronic Health Record (EHR) patient information. Participating organizations provide a HIPAA-defined limited data set to the centralized Cosmos database.

With over 34,200 Clinics and 1,522 Hospitals participating in Cosmos, researchers can access a representative sample of patients who seek healthcare. You can learn more about the latest features of Cosmos on Epic UserWeb, available to all Yale New Haven Health System (YNHHS) research users and on the Yale Cosmos Teams Site. title-block-banner: true format: html filters: - parse-latex editor: visual image: cover.png markdown: editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- ## Overview Researchers wanting to use the Yale New Haven Health System (YNHHS) Epic Cosmos data will require a Researcher Basic Access (RBA) account. This affords researchers access to: - [Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI)](https://medicine.yale.edu/ybic/computational-resources/ynhhs/#virtual-desktop-infrastructure): remotly access to a YNHHS secure device without requiring the YNHHS VPN. Includes software like VDI includes SQL Server Management Studio, R, Stata, SAS, Office365, and Epic and can be used to handle small-to-medium sized data, accessing Epic charts, Slicer-Dicer, and the CHP. - Epic SlicerDicer - Computational Health Platform (CHP) - asd ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}

````` ::: ::: ```{=latex} \begin{tabular}{|l|l|}\hline Age & Frequency \\ \hline 18--25 & 15 \\ 26--35 & 33 \\ 36--45 & 22 \\ \hline \end{tabular} ``` Researcher Basic Access (RBA) is a standard account enabling researchersâ€™ access to YNHHS essential research software and applications. All YU-YNHHS faculty and licensed providers are permitted to submit and sponsor access requests. If you need access, your manager or sponsor with a YNHHS account must complete the YNHHS Researcher Basic Access request. Things you will need to apply: - YNHHS Researcher Basic Access** (i.e. Research VDI, Epic Research, Slicer Dicer): https://shorturl.at/nJOS0 - HIPAA Certification - https://hipaa.yale.edu/training/training-modules - Human Subject Protection - https://shorturl.at/kyEQX - Slicer-Dicer proficiency demonstration*** - you may be contacted with details upon submitting this form. ::: callout-important If you are not a member of the YU-YNHHS Covered Entity (e.g. YSPH), you will need a sponsor from a covered component to submit on your behalf. Find the current "List of Covered Departments" under "Administrative Functions" on the [hippa.yale.edu](https://hipaa.yale.edu/resources/resource-documents-and-guidance) resources page. ::: ::: callout-important The Epic UserWeb email you submit with this form is how both Yale and Epic will contact you with respect to this application and all other Cosmos-related information. Your email should be your yale.edu or YNHHS email and you are responsible updating this information in your Epic user account. ::: ## Step-by-Step 1. Receive YNNHS basic access. ## Typical Timeline ::: callout-important Good things come with time. ::: ## Links, Contacts, and Forms/DUA's - [YNHH Cosmos Basic Access Request](https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=u76M3Tkh-E20EU4-h6vrXCsIf8QoYdVKgQBU9qSQku5UQ0FNUlpVR1FJTzgyMEtPU05GNlUyQTI0Qy4u&route=shorturl) submittal. ## Sources 1.
